children.value:
The top level 'api' is what is available to an app after the Citrix WebRTC SDK has been imported.
It contains various top-level functions that pertain to Citrix WebRTC SDK global instance, as well as event emitter methods.
Initializes the Citrix UC SDK and sets up the WebRTC SDK to run in Citrix proxy mode.

tags.description: api

tags.title: param
tags.description: The WebRTC JS SDK.
tags.name: SDK

tags.title: param

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_STATE` if Citrix proxy mode is already setup.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if provided SDK parameter is invalid.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_STATE` if active calls are ongoing.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `VERSION_MISMATCH` if WebRTC JS SDK and Citrix WebRTC SDK versions mismatch.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `CITRIX_SDK_ERROR` if Citrix UC SDK fails to initialize.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Resolves upon successful completion

Tears down the Citrix UC SDK and returns the WebRTC JS SDK to non-proxy mode.

This API will also trigger a device update within the WebRTC JS SDK after successfully
tearing down the proxies.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error if active calls are ongoing.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Resolves upon successful completion.

tags.title: example

children.value: Resolves upon successful completion.
Will throw an error if active calls are ongoing.
Returns whether proxy mode has been setup or not.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Returns true if proxy mode is setup, false otherwise.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // false
await citrixClient.setup(webrtcSDK)
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // true
citrixClient.teardown()
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // false

examples.description:
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // false
await citrixClient.setup(webrtcSDK)
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // true
citrixClient.teardown()
log(citrixClient.isSetup())     // false

children.value: Returns true if proxy mode is setup, false otherwise.

Sets an offset by which all video elements will be adjusted. Must be called prior to rendering the video stream to be adjusted. Should only be used in an Electron environment and will throw an error if called in a browser.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: param
tags.description: The number of pixels to adjust video elements left or right. A negative offset moves elements left, a positive number moves them right.
tags.name: xOffset

tags.title: param
tags.description: The number of pixels to adjust video elements up or down. A negative offset moves elements up, a positive number moves them down.
tags.name: yOffset

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_STATE` if Citrix proxy mode has not been set up.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_STATE` if Electron IPC functions have not been setup correctly.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `NOT_SUPPORTED` if called outside of Electron.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if the provided offset values are not of type 'number'.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Resolves upon successful completion

tags.title: example

children.value: The number of pixels to adjust video elements left or right. A negative offset moves elements left, a positive number moves them right.
The number of pixels to adjust video elements up or down. A negative offset moves elements up, a positive number moves them down.
Resolves upon successful completion
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_STATE
if Citrix proxy mode has not been set up.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_STATE
if Electron IPC functions have not been setup correctly.
Will throw an error with code
NOT_SUPPORTED
if called outside of Electron.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_PARAM
if the provided offset values are not of type 'number'.

Plays an audio file specified by a URL.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: param
tags.description: A simple text identifier for your app, e.g. 'dtmfFeedback'. Should be unique for the URL and speaker combination.
tags.name: audioId

tags.title: param
tags.description: The URL to the audio file to be played.
tags.name: url

tags.title: param
tags.description: The deviceId of the speaker the audio should be played from.
tags.name: speakerId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Length of time to play the audio file, in milliseconds.
tags.name: duration

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_STATE` if Citrix proxy mode has not been setup.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if an audioId is not provided.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if the url parameter is not valid.

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if the value of speakerId does not match one of the devices returned by the WebRTC JS SDK `media.getDevices().speaker`.

tags.title: throws
tags.description:
Will throw an error with code `INVALID_PARAM` if the value of duration is invalid.

Usage notes:
- If duration is specified and is longer than the length of specified audio file, playback will loop until `duration` expires.
- If duration is specified and is shorter than the length of specified audio file, playback will be truncated when `duration` expires.
- Therefore, when specifying duration, it is helpful to know the target file's playback length.
- If duration is not specified, the audio file will be played in its entirety once.
- Playback can be stopped at any time via the {@link api.stopAudio} API regardless of whether a duration is specified or not.
- Calling this API a second time for a given audioId will stop any previous ongoing playback for the same audioId

tags.title: example
tags.description:
const beep = 'https://example.server.com/audio/shortbeep.wav'
const incomingRingtone = 'https://example.server.com/audio/ringing.wav'
const speaker = webrtcClient.media.getDevices().speaker[0].deviceId

citrixClient.playAudio('dtmfFeedback', beep, speaker) // play shortbeep.wav once
citrixClient.playAudio('ringExternalSpeaker', incomingRingtone, speaker, 30000) // play incoming ringtone for up to 30 seconds; stop it via stopAudio if the user answers

examples.description:
const beep = 'https://example.server.com/audio/shortbeep.wav'
const incomingRingtone = 'https://example.server.com/audio/ringing.wav'
const speaker = webrtcClient.media.getDevices().speaker[0].deviceId

citrixClient.playAudio('dtmfFeedback', beep, speaker) // play shortbeep.wav once
citrixClient.playAudio('ringExternalSpeaker', incomingRingtone, speaker, 30000) // play incoming ringtone for up to 30 seconds; stop it via stopAudio if the user answers

children.value: A simple text identifier for your app, e.g. 'dtmfFeedback'. Should be unique for the URL and speaker combination.
The URL to the audio file to be played.
The deviceId of the speaker the audio should be played from.
Length of time to play the audio file, in milliseconds.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_STATE
if Citrix proxy mode has not been setup.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_PARAM
if an audioId is not provided.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_PARAM
if the url parameter is not valid.
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_PARAM
if the value of speakerId does not match one of the devices returned by the WebRTC JS SDK
media.getDevices().speaker
Will throw an error with code
INVALID_PARAM
if the value of duration is invalid.
Usage notes:
If duration is specified and is longer than the length of specified audio file, playback will loop until
duration
expires.
If duration is specified and is shorter than the length of specified audio file, playback will be truncated when
duration
expires.
Therefore, when specifying duration, it is helpful to know the target file's playback length.
If duration is not specified, the audio file will be played in its entirety once.
Playback can be stopped at any time via the
api.stopAudio
API regardless of whether a duration is specified or not.
Calling this API a second time for a given audioId will stop any previous ongoing playback for the same audioId
Stops any audio that's playing for the specified audidId. Has no effect if called after playback has already stopped.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: param
tags.description: The same identifier used to start audio playing. See {@link api.playAudio}
tags.name: audioId

tags.title: example
tags.description: citrixClient.stopAudio('ringExternalSpeaker')

children.value: The same identifier used to start audio playing. See
api.playAudio
Possible error codes for the errors thrown by the Citrix WebRTC SDK.
Each error thrown by the SDK is in the format of
api.CitrixError

. These error objects
include a code and message. The codes provide a basic hint as to what the error is as per descriptions below.
The message provides more context about the error encountered.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: property
tags.description: A CITRIX_SDK_ERROR error indicates that the Citrix UC SDK threw an error.
tags.name: CITRIX_SDK_ERROR

tags.title: property
tags.description: An INVALID_PARAM error indicates that an invalid parameter was passed to the API.
tags.name: INVALID_PARAM

tags.title: property
tags.description: An INVALID_STATE error indicates that SDK is in an invalid state to proceed with the operation.
tags.name: INVALID_STATE

tags.title: property
tags.description: A NOT_SUPPORTED error indicates that the SDK or one of its APIs is being used in an environment in which it is not supported for use.
tags.name: NOT_SUPPORTED

tags.title: property
tags.description: A VERSION_MISMATCH error indicates that the provided WebRTC SDK version does not match the Citrix WebRTC SDK version.
tags.name: VERSION_MISMATCH

tags.title: example

children.value: A CITRIX_SDK_ERROR error indicates that the Citrix UC SDK threw an error.
An INVALID_PARAM error indicates that an invalid parameter was passed to the API.
An INVALID_STATE error indicates that SDK is in an invalid state to proceed with the operation.
A NOT_SUPPORTED error indicates that the SDK or one of its APIs is being used in an environment in which it is not supported for use.
A VERSION_MISMATCH error indicates that the provided WebRTC SDK version does not match the Citrix WebRTC SDK version.
The CitrixError object. Provides information about an error that occurred in the Citrix WebRTC SDK.

tags.title: memberof
tags.description: api

tags.title: property
tags.description: One of {@link api.errorCodes}
tags.name: code

tags.title: property
tags.description: A human-readable message to describe the error.
tags.name: message

children.value: One of
api.errorCodes
A human-readable message to describe the error.
